thread.title: Attendance decreases, fails to crack 92,000 for first time since Cotton Bowl capacity increased
thread.title_full: Attendance decreases, fails to crack 92,000 for first time since Cotton Bowl capacity increased | Dallas Morning News

author: SportsDayDFW.com
title: Attendance decreases, fails to crack 92,000 for first time since Cotton Bowl capacity increased
text:
Attendance decreases For the first time since 2007, when the Cotton Bowl's capacity was 80,000, the AT&T Red River Showdown failed to crack 92,000 in attendance. A few empty pockets dotted the upper reaches of the Texas sections. Even with a few empty seats, the 91,546 at Saturday's game was the second-biggest crowd at a UT or OU game this season. Here's a look at the attendance since the stadium expansion:
Year Attendance Result 2015 91,546 UT, 24-17 2014 92,100 OU, 31-26 2013 92,500 UT, 36-20 2012 92,500 OU, 63-21 2011 96,009 OU, 55-17 2010 96,009 OU, 28-20 2009 96,009 UT, 16-13 2008 92182 UT, 45-35
